Title: What is Blazor [1 of 11] | Beginner's Series to: Blazor
Description: Blazor is a hot topic amongst the .NET Technical Community, but what is it and why should I be interested in it?  Let's learn about what Blazor is and how you can use it to make your web applications

Title: What’s Coming in React 18
Description: React 18 looks promising: automatic state batching, new APIs and a new streaming server renderer—all battled-tested in advance. Let’s take a closer look.

Title: Tips and Tricks when using Windows Package Manager
Description: Windows Package Manager is an open-source tool that can help you install and manage software on your PC.  I want to share some tips and hints that I have found while using the tool.   Settings You can tweak some settings by typing winget settings.  This will open the JSON file that allows you to cha...

Title: Discover and assess ASP.NET apps at-scale with Azure Migrate
Description: Azure Migrate is your central place in the Azure portal that provides a unified experience to discover, assess, and migrate your servers, databases, and web apps to Azure. Today, we are announcing the preview of at-scale, agentless discovery, and assessment of ASP.NET web apps to help you migr...

Title: .NET App Developer Links - 2021-08-18
Description: The latest news and resources for .NET app developers.

Title: What I Like About C# 9
Description: Let’s look at some of the new features of C# 9, an example that uses a Person class and expands on it, and even some expected C# 10 features.

Title: Exploring Clang/LLVM optimization on programming horror
Description: Recently, I've come across a not so efficient implementation of a isEven function (from r/programminghorror).

Title: Asking nicely for root command execution (and getting it)
Description:
There was a SEV review meeting once upon a time, and in it, we had 
reviewed some incident where something bad happened involving something 
that ran as root.  I don't remember the finer points of that one any 
more, but the resident VP who ran the show wondered aloud how much 
"root exposure" we had in our infra in general.  That got my attention.

Title: More. Helvetica. Now.
Description: Helvetica Now Variable gives you over a million new Helvetica styles in one state-of-the-art font file (over two-and-a-half million with italics!). Use it as an extension of the Helvetica Now family or make custom-blends from its weights (Hairline to ExtraBlack), optical sizes (four point to infinity), and new Compressed and Condensed widths.
